The 14626 / 14625 Firozpur Cantt. - Haridwar Weekly Express is an Express train of the Indian Railways connecting Firozpur in Punjab and  Haridwar in Uttarakhand. It was inaugurated on 18 June, 2025.
Coach composition
The train runs with 16 Linke-Hoffman Busch coaches, consisting of General (GEN), Sleeper (SL), AC 3-Tier (3A) and AC 2-Tier (2A) classes. It has a single rake, which it shares with the Firozpur Cantt. - Hazur Sahib Nanded Weekly Express. The primary maintainence is executed at .

Passengers are advised to check the coach position indicator at the station before boarding.
Timings
* The 14626 Firozpur Cantt. - Haridwar Weekly Express leaves  at 22:40 hrs every Wednesday and reaches  the next day at 08:30 hrs.
* The 14625 Haridwar â€“ Firozpur Cantt. Weekly Express leaves  at 14:45 hrs every Thursday and reaches  the next day at 00:35 hrs.
Traction
Since the route is fully electrified, the train is hauled by a Ludhiana based WAP 7 locomotive end to end.
